You are kidding right?Â While he "projects" to be an effective innings-eater, he is in actuality a guy who will toss 150-180 innings of near 5.00 ERA ball.Â His career WHIP shows he allows a ton of base runners and that is certainly not something the Astros need.Â Weiland has been nothing short of extremely good this spring and Lyles is young and has a far superoir arsenal.Â This is also not including Harrell who is having a very nice spring and is no doubt still in the mix for a rotation Spot should the Astros think Lyles needs more time in the minors.Â
The bottom line is that this team needs to see what these young guys have to offer and they are not going to be able to do so if they maintain the Ed Wade mentality of bringing in over-the-hill guys.
